sentence: One  can  count  ,  there  111  kings  (  not  forgetting  ,  to  be  sure  ,  the  Negro  kings  among  them  )  ,  7000  geographers  ,  900,000  businessmen  ,  7,500,000  tipplers  ,  311,000,000  conceited  men  -  -  that  is  to  say  ,  about  2,000,000,000  grown  -  ups  .

sentence: To  give  you  an  idea  of  the  size  of  the  Earth  ,  I  will  tell  you  that  before  the  invention  of  electricity  it  was  necessary  to  maintain  ,  over  the  whole  of  the  six  continents  ,  a  veritable  army  of  462,511  lamplighters  for  the  street  lamps  .

sentence: Only  the  man  who  was  in  charge  of  the  single  lamp  at  the  North  Pole  ,  and  his  colleague  who  was  responsible  for  the  single  lamp  at  the  South  Pole  -  -  only  these  two  would  live  free  from  toil  and  care  :  they  would  be  busy  twice  a  year  .
